-- This script was generated by the ERD tool in pgAdmin 4.
-- Please log an issue at https://redmine.postgresql.org/projects/pgadmin4/issues/new if you find any bugs, including reproduction steps.
BEGIN;


CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS fsweb.actor
(
    id integer NOT NULL GENERATED ALWAYS AS IDENTITY ( INCREMENT 1 START 1 ),
    first_name character varying(45) NOT NULL,
    last_name character varying(45) NOT NULL,
    gender character varying(10) NOT NULL,
    birth_date timestamp with time zone NOT NULL,
    PRIMARY KEY (id)
);

CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS fsweb.movie
(
    id integer NOT NULL GENERATED ALWAYS AS IDENTITY ( INCREMENT 1 START 1 ),
    director_name character varying(100) NOT NULL,
    rating integer NOT NULL,
    release_date timestamp with time zone NOT NULL,
    PRIMARY KEY (id)
);

CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS fsweb.actor_movie
(
    id integer NOT NULL GENERATED ALWAYS AS IDENTITY ( INCREMENT 1 START 1 ),
    actor_id integer NOT NULL,
    movie_id integer NOT NULL,
    PRIMARY KEY (id)
);

ALTER TABLE IF EXISTS fsweb.actor_movie
    ADD FOREIGN KEY (actor_id)
    REFERENCES fsweb.actor (id) MATCH SIMPLE
    ON UPDATE NO ACTION
    ON DELETE NO ACTION
    NOT VALID;


ALTER TABLE IF EXISTS fsweb.actor_movie
    ADD FOREIGN KEY (movie_id)
    REFERENCES fsweb.movie (id) MATCH SIMPLE
    ON UPDATE NO ACTION
    ON DELETE NO ACTION
    NOT VALID;

END;
